content: the sid sweater by out of the loops your pet s new favorite or most hated sweater the sid sweater is a stretchy sweater for cats or small dogs this quick and easy project is perfect for using yarn scraps to make your pet something cute and cozy this pattern may not be sold distributed or used for mass production of items for sale it is permissible to use this pattern to create small batch items to sell but please give credit to the designer copyright © 2025 out of the loops copyright © 2025 fleece & thank ewe fiber worx 1 materials ★ 60-190 grams of worsted to bulky weight yarn i used exclusively scrap yarn typically thinner yarns held together ★ 6 mm circular knitting needles 16 in ★ 6 mm double pointed needles dpns ★ bor stitch marker ★ knitting needle tip protectors optional abbreviations ★ bor = beginning of round ★ k2p2 = knit 2 stitches purl 2 stitches and repeat for all stitches ★ dpn = double pointed needle ★ follow in pattern = work each stitch as is if it s a knit stitch knit if it s a purl stitch purl ★ wrong side/inside = the inside of the sweater the side that will be against your pet ★ right side/outside = the outside of the sweater the side that will be facing out on the sweater ★ k2tog = knit 2 stitches together ★ p2tog = purl 2 stitches together measurements & sizing to determine the correct size take a measurement around the thickest part of your pet in the middle/tummy area to find circumference this sweater design is very stretchy with 4 in of positive ease worked into the pattern there are three size options small medium and chunky in the pattern the corresponding measurements are indicated as s m l small s tummy/middle of 16 in or smaller medium m tummy/middle of 16 - 22 in chunky l tummy/middle of 23 in or larger 2 step by step instructions s m l 1 on 6 mm circular knitting needles cast on 44 64 84 stitches using your favorite cast on method 2 join in the round and add a bor stitch marker 3 k2p2 for 20 30 40 rounds 4 next round k2p2 16 24 32 stitches onto a 6 mm dpn to be worked flat turn ○ leave the rest of your stitches on your circular needles to be worked flat as the back section next 5 on wrong side/inside k2tog follow in pattern to 2 stitches before the end of the row p2tog 6 on right side/outside follow all stitches in pattern 7 repeat steps 6 and 7 until you have 4 8 16 stitches remaining ○ you should be on a right side/outside row next 8 cut yarn from the front section and leave the front section stitches on dpns while working the back section 9 attach your yarn on the right side/outside of your back section
